title: The application of electrochemical impedance spectroscopy for investigation of enzyme kinetics

Z tohoto d\305\257vodu mohou b\303\275t pou\305\276ity pro studium kinetiky adsorpce makromolekul, ale tak\303\251 umo\305\276\305\210uj\303\255 studovat enzymovou kinetiku, jeliko\305\276 p\305\257soben\303\255m enzym\305\257 na substr\303\241ty se enzymy \303\272\304\215astn\303\255 modifikace a generov\303\241n\303\255 nabit\303\275ch \304\215\303\241stic na povrchu elektrody. V t\303\251to pr\303\241ci zkoum\303\241me potenci\303\241l elektrochemick\303\251 impedan\304\215n\303\255 techniky ke sledov\303\241n\303\255 kinetiky reakce na modelov\303\251m p\305\231\303\255kladu enzymu gluk\303\263za oxid\303\241zy a gluk\303\263zy jako substr\303\241tu. Enzym je vystaven r\305\257zn\303\275m koncentrac\303\255m substr\303\241tu a interakce se budou zaznamen\303\241vat v re\303\241ln\303\251m \304\215ase. O\304\215ek\303\241vaj\303\255 se zm\304\233ny v impedanci p\305\231i r\305\257zn\303\275ch koncentrac\303\255ch substr\303\241tu. Tyto zm\304\233ny by m\304\233ly n\303\241sledovat kinetiku Michaelis-Mentenov\303\251. Experiment\303\241ln\303\255 postup by m\304\233l b\303\275t jednoduch\303\275 a m\304\233l by b\303\275t prov\303\241d\304\233n v roztoc\303\255ch pufru bez po\305\276adavku na jak\303\251koliv dodate\304\215n\303\251 redoxn\303\255 pr\303\263by.The application of electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS) in theory and experiment for investigation of redox enzyme kinetics has been already described. The impedance studies are quite sensitive to the changes at the interface caused by adsorption of charged species and therefore can be used to study the kinetics of adsorption of macromolecules and also enables us to study enzyme kinetics since the action of the enzymes on their substrates involved modification and generation of charged species. In this work, we would explore the potential of electrochemical impedance technique to follow the kinetics of glucose oxidasesubstrate reactions on the immobilized surface. The enzyme will be allowed to interact with different concentrations of its substrate and the resulting reaction will be recorded in real time. Changes in the imaginary component of the impedance at various substrate concentrations will be expected to follow MichelisMenten kinetics. The experimental procedure should be simple and can be carried out directly in buffer solutions most suited for the required interaction to take place, without the requirement of any additional redox probes.
